Scan parameters¶

Functions to generate an array of positions for ptychographic scans

scan.xy_scan(pattern, center, width, height, step, random=True)¶

Generates a set of positions used for a ptychographic scan.

Parameters

  • pattern (str) – ‘rect’ for rectangular, ‘hex’ for hexagonal, ‘spiral’ for spiral/orchestral

  • center ((float, float)) – horizontal and vertical scan center position

  • width (float) – scan width in millimeters

  • height (float) – scan height in millimeters

  • step (float) – distance between nearest-neighbor positions

  • random (bool) – if True (default), assigns a small random shift to each position

Returns

X and Y scan positions, and number of total positions

Return type

(np.ndarray, np.ndarray, int)

scan.rect_scan(center, width, height, step, random)¶

Generates a rectangular ptychographic scan. Positions are aligned into rows and columns, such that the four nearest neighbors of each position are directly above, below, and to either side.

Parameters

  • width (float) – scan width in millimeters

  • center ((float, float)) – horizontal and vertical scan center position

  • height (float) – scan height in millimeters

  • step (float) – distance between nearest-neighbor positions

  • random (bool) – if True (default), assigns a small random shift to each position

Returns

X and Y scan positions, and number of total positions

Return type

(np.ndarray, np.ndarray, int)

scan.hex_scan(center, width, height, step, random)¶

Generates a hexagonal ptychographic scan. Positions are aligned into rows and (loosely) columns, such that the six nearest neighbors of each position form a regular hexagon.

Parameters

  • width (float) – scan width in millimeters

  • center ((float, float)) – horizontal and vertical scan center position

  • height (float) – scan height in millimeters

  • step (float) – distance between nearest-neighbor positions

  • random (bool) – if True (default), assigns a small random shift to each position

Returns

X and Y scan positions, and number of total positions

Return type

(np.ndarray, np.ndarray, int)

scan.spiral_scan(center, width, height, step, random)¶

Generates a spiral ptychographic scan. Positions are arranged spiraling out such that the points are spaced evenly along the path and the loops are spaced evenly from each other.

Parameters

  • width (float) – scan width in millimeters

  • center ((float, float)) – horizontal and vertical scan center position

  • height (float) – scan height in millimeters

  • step (float) – distance between nearest-neighbor positions

  • random (bool) – if True (default), assigns a small random shift to each position

Returns

X and Y scan positions, and number of total positions

Return type

(np.ndarray, np.ndarray, int)

scan.r_scan(num_steps=0, full_range=180)¶

Generates an array of rotational positions. This is basically just a fancy wrapper for np.linspace, but it includes a special case for non-rotational ptychographic scans.

Parameters

  • num_steps (int) – Number of rotational positions. If zero, the return value will allow for a non-rotational (2D) ptychography dataset.

  • full_range (float) – Full range of angles to sweep through.

Returns

1D array of angles

Return type

np.ndarray
